entry.title: Tech Talk John Blog
entry.content:
Work in Progress

Since the early days of the Internet, I have built several blogs from scratch or using blog technology du jour. This one is built using fastpages, which is a part of fast.aiâ€™s tool kit.

Fastpages

Fastpages supports creating blog post using Jupyter Notebooks, Markdown, and Microsoft Word.

My preference is creating posts using GitHub Markdown. Fastpages runs on GitHub, it is relatively easy to use, and GitHub markdown has some features that other markdown dialects do not have.

GitHub Pages

Fastpages uses GitHuB Pages, a cast of creative APIs, and apps that compile and deploy blogs.

Synopsis

  • compose blogs on your computer and save it to your local GitHub repository blob repository
  • save a copy to the local GitHub repository
  • copy the local repository to the GitHub repository.
  • GitHub saves all versions of the changes to the repository.
  • Fastpages automatically compiles the blog with new posting from the repository, adding the new posting to the blog
  • links to all blog postings are added to the home page, with post title, description, and date added to the blog
  • clicking a blog posting link opens the blog
  • a table of contents is created for each section of the blog post
  • the top of the blog post page has links to the blog About page, a search link for the entire blog, a link to all blog tags, and a link to the blog home page
